titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - Michael J. Hansen appointed as counsel as to defendant Michael Lee Vanness as ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(SED)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - Michael J. Hansen appointed as counsel as to defendant Michael Lee Vanness as ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(SED)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The Court has been advised that the defendant requests permission to enter a plea of guilty. The Court is further advised that the defendant will consent to Judge Piester conducting the hearing on the plea of guilty. IT IS ORDERED that: This case, insofar as it concerns this defendant, is removed from the trial docket based upon the oral motion of the defendant that is granted. A hearing on the defendant's anticipated plea of guilty is scheduled before Magistrate Judge Piester on the 23rd day of May, 2007 at the hour of 2:30 p.m. The time between today's date and the anticipated plea of guilty, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Defendant shall be present for this hearing as to defendant(s) Michael Lee Vanness. Change of Plea Hearing set for 5/23/2007 02:30 PM in Courtroom 2 (Lincoln) before Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(GJG, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The Court has been advised that the defendant requests permission to enter a plea of guilty. A hearing on the defendant's anticipated plea of guilty is scheduled before Magistrate Judge Piester on the 23rd day of May, 2007 at the hour of 2:30 p.m. The time between today's date and the anticipated plea of guilty, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Defendant shall be present for this hearing as to defendant(s) Michael Lee Vanness. Change of Plea Hearing set for 5/23/2007 02:30 PM in Courtroom 2 (Lincoln) before Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture is hereby sustained. Based upon Counts II and V of the Indictment and the Defendant's plea of guilty, the United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is hereby authorized to seize one H&K USP compact.45 caliber handgun, serial number 29-009141, and a Hi Point Firearms JHP.45 ACP pistol, serial X456206. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C., § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. Certified Copy to USM.(GJG, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture is hereby sustained. Based upon Counts II and V of the Indictment and the Defendant's plea of guilty, the United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is hereby authorized to seize one H&K USP compact.45 caliber handgun, serial number 29-009141, and a Hi Point Firearms JHP.45 ACP pistol, serial X456206. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C., § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. Certified Copy to USM.(GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - THIS MATTER comes before the Court on defendant's Request to File Motion Under Seal, filing 31. The Court, being fully advised in the premises, finds that said Motion should be granted. IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that, pursuant to NECrimR 49.3(c) and (d), the Clerk shall file defendant's Motion To Review Detention and Order under seal as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER denying 35 Motion for Release, as to Michael Lee Vanness. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER denying 35 Motion for Release, as to Michael Lee Vanness. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Michael Lee Vanness. It is ordered that: (1) There are no disputed matters regarding the presentence report and the proper computation of the advisory Guidelines ranges. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER sustaining 40 Government's Motion for Final Forfeiture as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). One H&K USP compact.45 caliber handgun, serial number 29-009141, and a Hi Point Firearms JHP.45 ACP pistol, serial X456206, shall be forfeited to the United States and the Marshal is directed to dispose of said properties. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. Certified copy to USM.(CCB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER sustaining 40 Government's Motion for Final Forfeiture as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). One H&K USP compact.45 caliber handgun, serial number 29-009141, and a Hi Point Firearms JHP.45 ACP pistol, serial X456206, shall be forfeited to the United States and the Marshal is directed to dispose of said properties. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. Certified copy to USM.(CCB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). Defendant plead guilty to Counts I through V and is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to imprisoned for a term of one hundred (100) months as to Counts I and III, said terms to run concurrently, and 60 months as to Count IV, said term to run consecutive to Counts I and III and all federal sentences shall run concurrent with the sentence imposed in Madison County district Court, Case No. CR06-248; followed by Supervised Release with Special Conditions for three (3) years on Count I and five (5) years on Counts III and IV, all periods of supervised release will run concurrent; $300 Special Assessment as to defendant(s) Michael Lee Vanness. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. 4 Certified Copies to USM. (GJG, ) Modified on 8/14/2007 to correct typo in text (GJG, ).

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Michael Lee Vanness (1). Defendant plead guilty to Counts I through V and is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to imprisoned for a term of one hundred (100) months as to Counts I and III, said terms to run concurrently, and 60 months as to Count IV, said term to run consecutive to Counts I and III and all federal sentences shall run concurrent with the sentence imposed in Madison County district Court, Case No. CR06-248; followed by Supervised Release with Special Conditions for three (3) years on Count I and five (5) years on Counts III and IV, all periods of supervised release will run concurrent; $300 Special Assessment as to defendant(s) Michael Lee Vanness. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. 4 Certified Copies to USM. (GJG, ) Modified on 8/14/2007 to correct typo in text (GJG, ).

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Michael Lee Vanness. It is ordered that: (1) Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion for reduction in sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 50 is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe; (2) Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw; (3) The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher; (4) The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Michael Lee Vanness. It is ordered that: (1) Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion for reduction in sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 50 is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe; (2) Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw; (3) The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher; (4) The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Vanness
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Michael Lee Vanness. It is ordered that:(1)The government's request for hearing 52 is granted.(2)A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 50 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Tuesday, February 9, 2010, at 12:00 noon, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska.(3)At the request of the defendant through his counsel, the defendant will participate in the hearing by telephone.(4)The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district.(5)The defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )
